topic.title: Get paid to watch porn ®
topic.body:
... how exactly do you get paid? The Steem blockchain has a standard known as SMT (Smart Media Token), which Vice’s proprietary cryptocurrency is built on. It enables all forms of engagement and participation to be rewarded, to include content producers who upload videos, content curators who find the best videos, and viewers like you who enjoy the videos. As you build up Vice tokens, you can do as you please with them. They can be converted to other cryptocurrencies, or fiat currencies...

https://blog.vice.org/getting-paid-to-watch-videos-how-does-that-work/

VICE.ORG announces the release of VICE Smart Media Token 

https://blog.vice.org/44-2/

topic.title: Zheroes, can you implement SchizoEditing?
topic.body:
mmm... identity, creativity, comments intereaction...

I imagine a sort of ZeroMedium clone... without comments!
I would say, a blogs aggregator with a wikilike editing capabilities:
if you want to contribute to a post you can select interesting text and trasform/comment it;
changes, accumulated in a list, are all click visitable (without changing surrounded text)
and sorted by "likes"

I think that this can transform comments in contributes
in an interesting coauthor way,
a complessification of text that is now a real experience in navigation,
but not as necessary in "composition"

topic.title: How can I (re)sign the content.json of that particular user?
topic.body:
I can't update [my hub](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1BbXU2hYZKRDj41JhYDc1L2g8JEb45U97c/) (created for [ZeroMe Feed Bot](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:22:ZeroMe+Feed+Bot))

if I *siteVerify* it I've this error
```
[ERROR] data/users/1P8mVfz49P4g5NWFmpFT9BcejHJBy2ybFF/content.json: invalid file: Invalid cert signer: kaffie.bit!
```

How can I (re)sign the *content.json* of that particular user?

---

I've tried
```
python2 zeronet.py siteSign $SITE --inner_path data/users/$USER/content.json
```
( [as suggested](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4/1526101000) by @Binchan )
but when I *siteVerify* the hub I've the same above error

---

anyway, if I add *--publish* at that command line the *data.json* content is published in the [user account](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Profile/1BbXU2hYZKRDj41JhYDc1L2g8JEb45U97c/1P8mVfz49P4g5NWFmpFT9BcejHJBy2ybFF/fluss0@kaffie.bit)

topic.title: Mozilla adds support for Decentralization Protocols in Firefox.
topic.body:
*Support for Decentralization Protocols*

Mozilla has always been a proponent of decentralization, recognizing that it is a key ingredient of a healthy Internet. Starting with Firefox 59, several protocols that support decentralized architectures are
approved for use by extensions. The newly approved protocols are:

- Dat Project (dat://) 
- IPFS (dweb:// ipfs:// ipns://) 
- Secure Scuttlebutt (ssb://) 

Firefox itself does not implement these protocols, but having them on the approved list means the browser recognizes them as valid protocols and extensions are free to provide implementations.

https://blog.mozilla.org/addons/2018/01/26/extensions-firefox-59/

topic.title: Beaker 1.0 Beta
topic.body:
> There are a ton of new additions. Let’s get straight to the fun parts – a new protocol, a new editing experience, and a new set of Web APIs.

> Beaker is now using the Hypercore Protocol. This breaking change includes a ton of new improvements:

> Performance is now vastly superior thanks to new data structures.
> Connection-reliability has improved thanks to a switch to a hole-punching DHT.
> A new “mounts” feature for composing multiple Hyperdrives into a single hierarchy.
> And much more...

https://beakerbrowser.com/

I don't understand how to sync, are there suggestions?

topic.title: Planet Earth: The Final Frontier. Twenty and ready for twenty more
topic.body:
Twenty years have passed since the birth of **Autistici / Inventati**. Twenty years have passed since we ventured down this quite complicated road. Like any respectable end of the year, it is again time for evaluations. End of the year balances are mostly political rather than financial for us, although we cannot deny that we will, as always, ask you to support us economically.

Twenty years ago nobody did what we do. And even today nobody does it the way we do it. This is important to remember because 20 years of work to keep our project alive and functional, relying
EXCLUSIVELY on the efforts of the volunteers involved and the spontaneous donations from our users deserve special attention.

Today is very easy to obtain an e-mail address or the space to host a website for free, and we know that mailing lists are mostly replaced by the millions of group chats provided by the various instant
messaging platforms. But we think that today it is much more difficult to find a free space where is possible to organize alternatives to the existing.

# Without alternative places there are no alternative thoughts, without spaces where it is possible to practice other ways of living, organize and imagine different worlds, it is not possible to change the existing one.

https://cavallette.noblogs.org/2020/12/9646

> [balancer73](#comment_5_1PniNzyi8fygvwyBaLpA9oBDVWZ5fXuJUw): gateway.ipfs.io is not part of the network, it is a centralized network development service. And tomorrow it can be closed or blocked. At work IPFS this will not affect, but all the usual Web-resources using this gate will stop working. Therefore, for my own purposes I use my own gates, as in ZeroNet :)

yes, I know, but gateway.ipfs.io seems a good compromise; if you have important content to share and you need more security you can install your own proxy, but if don't you can use a good proxy... at your own risk

so, if it's true, what can I do?

how can I verify my occupied space on ZeroMe?

> [quantumworld](#comment_281_1AdWXZdPUimpXoGNXUBde2CHR7gLf4onxE): Try this. Left click and hold zeronet icon 8 looking thing and drag left. Go to the bottom of that slider page and make sure the This is my site button is turned off. That may be the error you are getting. Then shut down zeronet. Clear browser cache and reboot machine. This will take care of multiple possible fault state variables that can cause errors.  All computers glitch out over long term run times.

already done, but without solving the problem

1573477450_144CwRj8eynTUC9DtGHaNHR3wm9P2.body:
An attempt to create a dedicated browser for ZeroNet using PyQt5

This browser advantage compare to others is that it is bundle with ZeroNet in it.

It understand zero: url and will soon be filled with others ZeroNet specific features (dev tools, blocking clearnet, zeronet gui commands, app store, Tor out of the box, ...).

https://github.com/rllola/ZeronetBrowser

# Hong Kong Polytechnic University: Protesters still inside as standoff continues

Up to 200 anti-government protesters remain barricaded inside a Hong Kong university, surrounded by police, as the standoff continues for a third day.

https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-50465337

# Arrestees Treated Brutally by Police

Police arrested several civilians and tied their hands at their back with cable ties. They were forced to lie onto the ground while facing downwards.

https://t.me/guardiansofhongkong/11896

Fight for freedom!

> "For the land of the free and the home of the brave,
> We are not Rioters
> We are Gamblers
> Gambling with our own Future."

https://t.me/guardiansofhongkong/11891

# Stampede in Yau Ma Tei on November 18

(19 Nov) At about 23:30 on November 18, a group of demonstrators was chased by the police to the Yau Ma Tei MTR station. Some stumbled to the ground. People on the scene were being stepped on due to the chaos. The police separated the firefighters and first-aid personnel from the protesters as firefighters and first-aid workers were providing assistance. They also refused the press access to the scene. Police officers arrested individuals who attempted to rescue and provided assistance to the protesters. However, they did not provide aid to the injured protesters. Police officers attacked reporters with pepper spray, hindering and preventing reporters from filming.

Kong Wing Cheung, Senior Superintendent of the Police Public Relations Branch, said at a press conference this afternoon that he had not received any reports of "human stampede" in the dispersal operation in Yau Ma Tei yesterday. The police's arguments obviously deviate from the truth. In fact, the situation last night was a #stampede and 31 people were injured and hospitalized in the process where 16 of them were classified as serious cases. Whether frontline police officers lied or the Police Public Relations Branch lied is irrelevant. Either way, the intention is to dilute the situation in order to escape responsibility. This act is shameful and the public cannot and should not accept this.

https://t.me/guardiansofhongkong/11898

Source: USP United Social Press

02:56 Mongkok

After the gunshot was heard, it is believed that the police had fired at least one live round to disperse the crowd. People at the scene fled in fear. Many were injured in the stampede occurred. Objects like umbrellas and personal belongings were scattered on the street.

https://t.me/guardiansofhongkong/11900

#FiveDemandsNotOneLess
#FreeHongKong

Disclaimer : 
Translated and forwarded from Internet

# The 721 Des Voeux Road Manifesto

To Hong Kongers and friends in all corners of the world who care about Hong Kong:
 
We are Hong Kong citizens who love our city dearly. Ever since early June this year millions of Hong Kongers have used various peaceful and non-violent means, including but not limited to marches and demonstrations, to convey to the government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region and the world our firm and reasoned commitment to safeguard our freedom. 

Some protesters have even risked everything, including their personal safety, to occupy the Legislative Council Building. Within roughly one month, a few brothers and sisters have sacrificed their own lives, hoping to give a much-needed wake-up call to the conscience of those in power and arouse the compassion of their fellow citizens. Sadly, all these sacrifices have only met with the government’s cruel disregard and the Chief Executive’s repeated refusal to retract the widely opposed Fugitive Offenders and Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters Legislation (Amendment) Bill.

What is even more unforgivable is the government’s tactic of sustaining their disregard, which is to let the police abuse protesters in every march and demonstration with unjustifiable excessive force, resulting in injuries of many. Meanwhile, the Chief Executive, high-ranking government officers and pro-establishment lawmakers have all refused to address the people’s demands, imagining that political problems can be solved by assaulting citizens and viewing the people as their enemies.

Today, we reiterate our five demands to the Hong Kong SAR government. We demand [them] to:
 
1. Withdraw without any ambiguity the Fugitive Offenders (Amendment) Bill, in order to officially terminate the legislative procedure of the Bill;
 
2. Withdraw the characterisation of the June 12th conflict as a riot;
 
3. Dismiss all charges already made against all citizens who protested [against] the Fugitive Offenders (Amendment) Bill, and guarantee that no further charges will be made against protesters because of these incidents;
 
4. Set up an independent commission of inquiry to conduct an impartial investigation into the police’s abuses of power; and
 
5. Dissolve the Legislative Council with an executive order, and immediately implement genuine universal suffrage with direct elections for both the Chief Executive and the Legislative Council.
 
We love Hong Kong dearly, and we do not wish to see another drop of blood shed [while] protecting our homeland, let alone another precious life lost. Yet, and let us stress this, there are no violent protesters or rioters, there is only tyranny. We will protect our homeland by any means. We urge the government to stop leading Hong Kong towards the brink of destruction and work together with the people to bring our city back to the path of a united, democratic, free and just society.

https://t.me/guardiansofhongkong/244

1584077470_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body: No, because I think our freedom is more important than our security

> [gitcenter](#comment_1249_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What about RCE? Your users.json might easily be stolen, all your files might be accessible from outside. Is that what you want?

Absolutely not, but I think that every update should be a choice; anyway we also consider that software evolution is not an end user choice so we can  consider "Unattended updates" as this kind of undecision

> [xplosive](#comment_63_1Jgu3kQaBojGnFj82E6Gd3tsyAsKCk5SX6): Software evolution on each individual's computers is really an end user choice. You may use whatever software you like to use. Nowadays I still use MS-DOS 6.22, Windows 3.11, Windows 95, Windows 98, Windows 2000, Windows XP, and a lot of old games. Many other people also do this.

Yes, but what I mean is that, for example, windows is windows, you (if you're not a coder) can't determine the software as is, you, obiouvusly, can choose what kind of software to install

And we can consider "Unattended updates" as a coder ,not an end user, choice of software evolution

> [gitcenter](#comment_1258_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): True. What about, say, allowing the user to enable/disable unattended security updates when ZeroNet is installed (recommend enabling it though, many users can't read unfortunately) and allowing them to cancel the update when they've received one (e.g. if they're doing something important on ZeroNet right now). The latter would mean that the update should only be installed in a while after it's received, e.g. 30 minutes.

I think it's necessary only the possibility to (un)select these automatic installations (it's a coder respect of end users; it's digital democratic culture, a p2p relation)
